scaleSSD.data¶

scaleSSD.data.coco_dataset¶

class scaleSSD.data.coco_dataset.COCODataset(step, annos_path, image_dir, no_classes, input_size, annos_encoder, random_seed)¶

Bases: Generic[torch.utils.data.dataset.T_co]

This is a class that maps a coco formatted dataset to the custom ssd model rgb input

Parameters

  • step (str) – the train procedure step (train, val, test)

  • annos_path (str) – the path to the annotations file

  • image_dir (str) – the path to the images directory

  • input_size (tuple[int,int]) – tuple containing the image size expected by the model

  • annos_encoder (BboxEncoder) – instance of BboxEncoder, responsible for encoding annotation data

  • random_seed (int, optional) – the random seed to initialize dataset spliting, defaults to 0

scaleSSD.data.coco_dataset.get_step_ids(step, total_ids, random_seed, val_ratio=0.15)¶

Get datapoint ids for each train procedure step

Parameters

  • total_ids (list[int...]) – list containing the total dataset ids

  • random_seed (int) – the ransom seed specifying the spliting of the dataset

  • val_ratio (float, optional) – specifies the percentage of the training data to be used for validation, defaults to 0.15

Returns

the chosen datapoint ids

Return type

list[int…]

scaleSSD.data.coco_dataset.process_img_data(img_data, annos_mapper, input_size, transformer)¶

Process image data to make them ready for the model

Parameters

  • annos_mapper (Union(BboxMapper, MasksMapper)) – maps annotation data to a format ready for the model. Can be either a BboxMapper or a MasksMapper

  • input_size (tuple[int, int]) – tuple containing the input size of the model

  • transformer (albumentations.Compose) – it will apply transforms to an input image and annotation data

Returns

dict containing the processed image data

Return type

dict

scaleSSD.data.data_modules¶

class scaleSSD.data.data_modules.DataModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule

This is a class, responsible for initialing the datasets for each step

Parameters

  • batch_size (int) – the max size of each batch

  • input_size (tuple[int, int]) – tuple containing the input size of the model

  • data_paths (dict) – dict containing paths for train and test datasets

  • no_classes (int) – number of classes in the dataset

  • annos_encoder (BboxEncoder) – instance of BboxEncoder, responsible for encoding bounding box annotations

get_dataset(step, rseed=0)¶

Create and return a dataset for each step (train, val, test)

Parameters

  • step (str) – the the of the train procedure. Can be (train, test, val)

  • rseed (int, optional) – the random seed to initialize dataset spliting, defaults to 0

Returns

the created dataset

Return type

torch.utils.data.Dataset

A custom collate function to group batch data

Parameters

Returns

a dict containing the grouped batch data

scaleSSD.data.transforms¶

class scaleSSD.data.transforms.RGBTransformer(input_size)¶

Bases: object

This class is responsible for transforming rgb model input data

Parameters

input_size (tuple(int, int)) – specified image input size for resizing

transform_image(image, bboxes, class_labels)¶

Transform an image by applying all albumentations

Parameters

  • image (numpy array) – the input image of the model

  • bboxes (numpy array) – an array containing the annotation boxes of the image

  • class_labels (numpy array) – an array containing the class labels for the boxes

Returns

the transformed image, bboxes, class_labels

Return type

tuple(list, list, list)
